channel.title: Getting a runtime error every time I try to grab a random value from an array
channel.description:
I've created an array and I try to grab a random value from it, but for some reason the server dies on me :'( It makes me quite sad :'( Here's my array: [code=java]int[] dropItems = {1053, 1055, 1057, 1959, 1961, 1965, 1965, 1965, 2595, 2597, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048};[/code] And here is where I try to grab it: [code=java]sendMessage("ID: "+dropItems[(int) (Math.random() * dropItems.length - 1)]+"");[/code] And I get this error:
[client-1-James]: playerCommand: dropparty java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1 at java.lang.String.substring(Unknown Source) at java.lang.String.substring(Unknown Source) at client.customCommand(client.java:13884) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:22631) at client.packetProcess(client.java:18092) at client.packetSending(client.java:18045) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:153) at server.main(server.java:49) pimpscape Server [fatal] - exception

item.title: Getting a runtime error every time I try to grab a random value from an array
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

Alright, I added your method, heres my code:

sendMessage("ID: "+randomDrops()+""); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX+2,absY-2, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX+2,absY-1, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX+2,absY, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX+2,absY+1, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX+2,absY+2, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX+1,absY-2, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX+1,absY-1, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX+1,absY, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX+1,absY+1, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX+1,absY+2, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX,absY-2, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX,absY-1, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX,absY, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX,absY+1, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX,absY+2, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX-1,absY-2, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX-1,absY-1, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX-1,absY, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX-1,absY+1, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX-1,absY+2, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX-2,absY-2, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX-2,absY-1, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX-2,absY, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX-2,absY+1, 1); createGroundItem(randomDrops(), absX-2,absY+2, 1);

Still getting the same error.

Read full topic

@relmitos wrote:

Java’s Math class stinks!

import java.util.Random;

Random random = new Random()
sendMessage("ID: " + dropItems[random.nextInt(dropItems.length))];

item.title: Getting a runtime error every time I try to grab a random value from an array
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

I’ve created an array and I try to grab a random value from it, but for some reason the server dies on me :’(
It makes me quite sad :’(

Here’s my array:

int[] dropItems = {1053, 1055, 1057, 1959, 1961, 1965, 1965, 1965, 2595, 2597, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048};

And here is where I try to grab it:

sendMessage("ID: "+dropItems[(int) (Math.random() * dropItems.length - 1)]+"");

And I get this error:

[client-1-James]: playerCommand: dropparty java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1 at java.lang.String.substring(Unknown Source) at java.lang.String.substring(Unknown Source) at client.customCommand(client.java:13884) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:22631) at client.packetProcess(client.java:18092) at client.packetSending(client.java:18045) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:153) at server.main(server.java:49) pimpscape Server [fatal] - exception
